Indian Economy.title: How Aunta-Simaria bridge in Bihar will be a gamechanger for connectivity and economy
Indian Economy.summary: Aunta-Simaria Bridge Construction: The Aunta–Simaria bridge has been constructed parallel to an old 2-lane rail-cum-road bridge "Rajendra Setu." Built around seven decades ago, the Rajendra Setu has long been a lifeline for the region.

Indian Economy.summary: The programme is open to graduates from any stream. Selection will be based on a qualifier test conducted by Masai, followed by a counselling process before admission

Indian Economy.summary: Meghalaya aims to double farmers' incomes by 2032 through strategic pineapple value chain development and global market expansion.

Banking & Finance.title: SMBC receives RBI approval to acquire up to 24.99% stake in YES Bank
Banking & Finance.summary: Post stake acquisition, SMBC would not be treated as a promoter of YES Bank, but would be its largest shareholder, the central bank said

Banking & Finance.title: Yes Bank stake sale to Sumitomo gets RBI nod
Banking & Finance.summary: Japanese lender SMBC gets RBI approval to acquire up to 24.99% in Yes Bank, marking the largest cross-border investment in India’s banking sector; SBI, other banks to sell shares.

Banking & Finance.title: ‘No other option, but we need time’: Mumbai ladi pav makers worry if their businesses will survive switch to green fuel
Banking & Finance.summary: As of July, Mumbai is home to 573 operational bakeries, according to data procured from the BMC. Of these, 187 have already adopted greener fuel sources such as electricity or piped natural gas.

Banking & Finance.title: London School of Economics (LSE) vs Wharton School: All you need to know about courses, careers, and costs
Banking & Finance.summary: Both institutions command international prestige. LSE is recognised worldwide as a hub of economic thought and public policy research, while Wharton has built its reputation as the leading school for business and finance education.

Banking & Finance.title: RBI at fork in the road, experts back chasing headline inflation
Banking & Finance.summary: Since food accounts for a large chunk of many Indians' spending, skipping its effect in inflation targeting is seen as not reflecting the daily experience of millions of Indians.

Technology Sector.title: As EU buckles under US pressure on climate trade regulations, India to press for similar relief in upcoming talks
Technology Sector.summary: The carbon tax, which will ensure that imported carbon-intensive goods into the EU bear a carbon cost starting January 2026, is seen by several developing nations as discriminatory.
